Neil O'Carroll

JavaScript Developer @ FieldAware

A versatile, motivated and business-minded software developer with proven experience at all stages of the web application lifecycle; from requirements gathering, to product design, implementation, and delivery.

Work

FieldAware
2017 - Present

In September 2017, I joined the core application team at FieldAware, a company specialising in delivering field service management solutions to thousands of customers across several regions including the USA and Australia.

Based out of the Dublin 8 office, I am working on delivering new UI functionality on FieldAware's core product, as well as enhancing internal company tools, and refactoring legacy code to modern standards.

Centuri Analytics
2015 - 2017

As UI developer at Centuri Analytics, I worked on a range of patient flow optimisation projects to develop innovative software solutions for different stages of the patient journey.

I worked closely with senior consultants, nurses, finance specialists and process improvement managers to gather requirements, refine ideas and iterate quickly to produce software that enables more efficient department communication, enhances organisational capability, promotes patient safety, and increases compliance with department best practices.

My role at Centuri focused on modern web application development with JavaScript and related technologies, but I also handled UX/UI design responsibilities, requirements gathering and QA for our patient flow management products, as well as delivering presentations to new and existing clients including senior consultants, business managers and C-Suite hospital staff.

The first project I deployed with Centuri was LaminOS.ED, a Patient Flow Management System currently used by doctors, nurses and healthcare assistants to manage patients 24/7 in St. James's Hospital Emergency Department, one of the busiest Emergency Departments in Ireland.

In March 2017, the LaminOS.ED project was profiled by the Irish Times newspaper and recieved the cover feature of the midweek health supplement of the print edition.

About

This website presents work-related information about the author, Neil O'Carroll, as an informal CV for potential future employers, collaborators or business contacts. As I am a Human‚Ñ¢, there is more to me than just my academic credentials and employment history. Below are some quick notes on my hobbies, interests and background.

Bio

I grew up in Tralee, in the South West of Ireland, but I currently live and work in Dublin. I'm interested in technology, web, music, human languages and design. Before coming into the dev world, I worked as an English language teacher while also doing audio and music recording projects on the side.

Music

Much of my free time is spent writing, recording and performing music, sometimes on the guitar and sometimes using a computer.

I first became interested in development through dabbling in sound design for film and video games, and I try to find a few hours every week to make some fresh bleeps and bloops with Ableton Live or, more recently, the Sonic Pi - a really cool FOSS project for live coding music in Ruby.

Sports

To keep (somewhat) fit, I train at a kickboxing gym a few nights a week, and occassionally play 5-a-side football at the weekends.

Emoji

Don't @ me.

Misc.

If you've read this far, your reward is the first JavaScript web app I wrote as a web underling, in all its raw HTML/CSS/JS glory.
